Issues.Title: dotnet 5.0 preview8 wpf throw System.UriFormatException when not use english project name
Issues.Body:
If I do not use English as the project name of the WPF program,e.g. Japanese, Chinese.
Exception thrown when WPF application runs into control's InitializeComponent method.
Exception:`System.UriFormatException:“Invalid URI: The Authority/Host could not be parsed.”`

Environment:
Visual Studio Enterprise 16.8.0 Preview 2.0
.NET SDK v5.0.0-preview.8
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "dotnet 5.0 preview8 wpf throw System.UriFormatException when not use english project name" (#3388)

Issues.Title: Adding dotnet3.1/dotnet-eng packages sources
Issues.Body:
In order to remove dependencies on sleet from release branches,
it is neccessary to preemptively add these sources so that mehanisms
will be able to restore these packages.

Sleet must be removed because of it's strong dependency on spcific
nuget.packaging versions, which are not stable between 3.0 and 3.1
causing method load exceptions.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Adding dotnet3.1/dotnet-eng packages sources" (#3387)

Issues.Title: WPF apps, published with dotnet publish with arguments -p:PublishTrimmed=true or /p:IncludeAllContentInSingleFile=true fails to run
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 3.0.103; 3.1.401; 5.0.100-preview.7
* Windows version: Windows 10 Pro x64, 2004 (19041.450)
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: No
* Is this bug related specifically to tooling in Visual Studio (e.g. XAML Designer, Code editing, etc...)?: No

 <!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->
 
 **Problem description:** WPF apps, published with `dotnet publish` with arguments `-p:PublishTrimmed=true` or `/p:IncludeAllContentInSingleFile=true` (*not always, please, read below*) fails to run.
 
 **Actual behavior:** Nothing happens after trying to run the app.
 
 **Expected behavior:** New window opens.
 
 **Minimal repro:**

Here's a simple `pwsh` script to create a sample wpf-app and publish it. Some of apps runs (as expected), but some not, they're noted in sript with comments.

```ps
dotnet new wpf -o test
Set-Location test

# Runs correctly

dotnet publish -c Release -r win-x64 -o Publish/5/Simple -f net5.0
dotnet publish -c Release -r win-x64 -o Publish/5/Include -f net5.0 /p:IncludeAllContentInSingleFile=true
dotnet publish -c Release -r win-x64 -o Publish/5/R2R -f net5.0 -p:PublishReadyToRun=true
dotnet publish -c Release -r win-x64 -o Publish/5/R2RSingle -f net5.0 -p:PublishReadyToRun=true -p:PublishSingleFile=true
dotnet publish -c Release -r win-x64 -o Publish/5/R2RSingleSelfC -f net5.0 -p:PublishReadyToRun=true -p:PublishSingleFile=true --self-contained true

# Publishes, but not runs

dotnet publish -c Release -r win-x64 -o Publish/5/Trim -f net5.0 -p:PublishTrimmed=true
dotnet publish -c Release -r win-x64 -o Publish/5/R2RSingleSelfCInclude -f net5.0 -p:PublishReadyToRun=true -p:PublishSingleFile=true --self-contained true /p:IncludeAllContentInSingleFile=true
dotnet publish -c Release -r win-x64 -o Publish/5/R2RSingleSelfCTrim -f net5.0 -p:PublishReadyToRun=true -p:PublishSingleFile=true --self-contained true -p:PublishTrimmed=true
```

**Additional info:** I must also say, that I've tested this script for `netcoreapp3.0` and `netcoreapp3.1` (with adding `TargetFrameworks` to `.csproj` and removing of `/p:IncludeAllContentInSingleFile=true`, since it appeared in `net5.0`) and the app still fails to run in same cases.
I've also tested this for `dotnet new console` (*Hello world*) app and it seems to run correctly for all cases.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "WPF apps, published with dotnet publish with arguments -p:PublishTrimmed=true or /p:IncludeAllContentInSingleFile=true fails to run" (#3386)

Issues.Title: WPF can not work well with set IsPressAndHoldEnabled to false when enable pointer message
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 3.1.301
* Windows version: (`winver`)
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: Yes
 
 **Problem description:**

We can use `Stylus.IsPressAndHoldEnabled="False"` to hide the touch feedback when we enable touch feedback in Windows 10.

It can work well when we do not enable the WM_Pointer message.

How to enable touch feedback in Windows 10? See [3 Ways to Enable or Disable Touch Feedback in Windows 10](https://www.top-password.com/blog/enable-or-disable-touch-feedback-in-windows-10/ )
 
 **Actual behavior:**

We can find the touch feedback when we enable WM_Pointer message.

<!-- ![](image/WPF can not work well with set IsPressAndHoldEnabled to false when enable pointer message/WPF can not work well with set IsPressAndHoldEnabled to false when enable pointer message.gif) -->

![](http://image.acmx.xyz/lindexi%2FWPF%2520can%2520not%2520work%2520well%2520with%2520set%2520IsPressAndHoldEnabled%2520to%2520false%2520when%2520enable%2520pointer%2520message.gif)
 
 **Expected behavior:**
 
The behavior of the WPF application is the same as before enable the WM_Pointer message.

We can use `Stylus.IsPressAndHoldEnabled="False"` to hide the touch feedback. When we hold the screen, the gray rectangle is not displayed.

 **Minimal repro:**

https://github.com/lindexi/lindexi_gd/tree/41884562/KemjawyecawDurbahelal
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "WPF can not work well with set IsPressAndHoldEnabled to false when enable pointer message" (#3379)

Issues.Title: Incorrect display of hyperlink decorators
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: **3.1.7 commit: fcfdef8d6b**
* Windows version: **win7-x64**
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: **Yes**

 
 **Problem description:**

ListBox and ListView incorrect displays Hyperlink underline decorators when mouse moves over.
![Issue](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29519681/90934500-9a334780-e42b-11ea-9704-d51a313fe77f.jpg)

**Actual behavior:** 
![Current behaviour](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29519681/90934427-7a038880-e42b-11ea-960a-b05f6cf6c7e1.gif)
I saw no more than 3 broken decorators and it looks like the position of the problem area inside ItemsControl (IC) is related to position of IC in Window.

 **Minimal repro:**
https://github.com/NotThatBen/HyperLInk-Issue
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Incorrect display of hyperlink decorators" (#3363)
